sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with complex coefficients
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations with complex coefficients:

x + 2y - 3z = 7-3i

2x - 3y + 4z = -6+4i

3x + 4y - 5z = 3+i
message_2:
To solve this system of linear equations, we can use the Gaussian elimination method. First, we'll write the augmented matrix for the given system:

```
| 1  2 -3 |  7-3i |
| 2 -3  4 | -6+4i |
| 3  4 -5 |  3+i  |
```

Step 1: Eliminate the coefficients below the first pivot (1):

Row 2 = Row 2 - 2 * Row 1:
```
| 1  2  -3 |  7-3i |
| 0 -7  10 | -20+10i|
| 3  4  -5 |  3+i  |
```

Row 3 = Row 3 - 3 * Row 1:
```
| 1  2  -3 |  7-3i |
| 0 -7  10 | -20+10i|
| 0 -2  4  | -18+8i|
```

Step 2: Eliminate the coefficients below the second pivot (-7):

Row 3 = Row 3 - (2/7) * Row 2:
```
| 1  2  -3 |  7-3i |
| 0 -7  10 | -20+10i|
| 0  0  2  | -12+6i|
```

Step 3: Back-substitution:

z = (-12+6i) / 2 = -6+3i

y = (-20+10i - 10z) / -7 = (-20+10i - 10(-6+3i)) / -7 = (40-20i) / -7 = -20/7 + 10i/7

x = (7-3i - 2y + 3z) = (7-3i - 2(-20/7 + 10i/7) + 3(-6+3i)) = (7-3i + 40/7 - 20i/7 - 18 + 9i) = (11/7 - 4i/7)

So the solution is:

x = 11/7 - 4i/7
y = -20/7 + 10i/7
z = -6 + 3i
